css.name: Less
css.intro: Less is a CSS pre-processor, meaning that it extends the CSS language, adding features that allow variables, mixins, functions and many other techniques that allow you to make CSS that is more maintainable, themable and extendable.

css.name: Sass
css.intro: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

js.name: jQuery
js.intro: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, animation, and Ajax much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers. With a combination of versatility and extensibility, jQuery has changed the way that millions of people write JavaScript.

js.name: MooTools
js.intro: MooTools is a collection of JavaScript utilities designed for the intermediate to advanced JavaScript developer. It allows you to write powerful and flexible code with its elegant, well documented, and coherent APIs.

js.name: Zepto
js.intro: Zepto is a minimalist JavaScript library for modern browsers with a largely jQuery-compatible API. If you use jQuery, you already know how to use Zepto.

framework.name: Bootstrap
framework.intro: Bootstrap is the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.

framework.name: Foundation
framework.intro: The most advanced responsive front-end framework in the world.

framework.name: Amaze UI
framework.intro: 中国首个开源 HTML5 跨屏前端框架

resource.name: W3schools
resource.intro: W3Schools is optimized for learning, testing, and training. Examples might be simplified to improve reading and basic understanding.

resource.name: Htmlgoodies
resource.intro: A team of developers created an HTML5 app for a major website that offers a much more sophisticated user experience on each of the mobile platforms commonly in use today. The tools they used eliminated much of the custom coding required to bring the desired features to each platform.

resource.name: Quackit
resource.intro: Ian initially created Quackit in order to point web developers to resources that could potentially help them build better websites. Some of these resources were available from the Quackit website itself, others were from third party websites.

resource.name: Html
resource.intro: People often think it is extremely difficult to make a website. That is not the case! Everyone can learn how to make a website. Use our tutorials on HTML and CSS and PHP and JavaScript and start building your own website in about an hour.

resource.name: Tizag
resource.intro: Tizag was designed to teach beginner web programmers how to use HTML and CSS. We invite you to begin the tutorials right away.

resource.name: Htmldog
resource.intro: Welcome to HTML Dog, the web designer’s resource for everything HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, the most common technologies used in making web pages.

resource.name: Pageresource
resource.intro: Pageresource is a Web Development Tutorial and Information Site.

resource.name: Htmlcodetutorial
resource.intro: Welcome to the HTML Code Tutorial. Our goal is to provide the most helpful and complete guide to creating web pages anywhere.

resource.name: Tuts+
resource.intro: Tuts+ helps you learn creative skills and shape the life you want.

resource.name: Webreference
resource.intro: One of the oldest (created in 1995) and most respected Web development sites, WebReference.com is all about the Web and Webmastery. From browsing to authoring, HTML to advanced site design, we’ll keep you informed.
